content.question:
The graph of a differentiable function f on the closed interval [1,7] is shown above. Let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>x</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@437D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for 1 ≤ x ≤ 7.

(a) Find h(1).

frqParts.text:
The graph of a differentiable function f on the closed interval [1,7] is shown above. Let <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <munderover> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>x</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@437D@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for 1 ≤ x ≤ 7.

(a) Find h(1).
(c) On what interval or intervals is the graph of h concave upward? Justify your answer.

(d) Find the value of x at which h has its minimum on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> [ </mo> <mrow> <mn> 1 </mn> <mo> , </mo> <mn> 7 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ] </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> . Justify your answer.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
